text: Bottle into a tulip. Pours black, with a small brown head that lasts. Nose is dark roast malt. Taste is dark malt, cocoa, and caramel. Creamy mouth feel, well balanced. Delicious.
Bottle from Liquor Barn. Aroma of roasted malts, wood, alcohol, and dark fruits.

Bottled. Black liquid with a small head diminishing to a beige circle around the glass. Nose is caramel malt, woody notes, molasses, dark dried fruits, hint of vanilla. Full body, very nice mouth feel. Taste is sweetness at first, some dark dried fruits, roasted malt, than wooden notes with an alcohol finish warming the throat, long aftertaste. Very unique one! I love it!

12%ABV. Brown ale.

Tapped out black brown, almost black. 38ºSRM.

Nose has carmelized nuts.

Mouthfeel is syrupy and smooth. Palate has caramel, toffee, butterscotch, praline pecans. There is aged pipe tobacco in the palate as well.

The finish is medium and woody and lightly bitter. Perfect finish to a hefty boozy complex ale. You get honeyed figs on the very tail end of the finish.

Goes on favorites list!

bottle @ Chief Market / Lima OH --- Aroma of dark malt, dark fruit and earth. Opaque dark brown color, brown head that drops to a thin cover, lace bands. Taste is syrupy dark roasted malt with wisps of smoke and a subtle alcohol overtone. Prune, black currant, and molasses enter after the swallow. Very strong, very heavy in the belly, which keeps it from "top dog" status.

dark brown colour, one inch creamy dark beige head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of cherry bonbon made with dark chocolate and some cherry liqueur, dried plum soaked in alcohol, hints of vanilla and some unroasted green coffee beans; taste of dark chocolate, dried cherry and plum soaked in liqueur, vanilla, mild roasted coffee, walnut, hints of (over-)roasted sunflower seeds/peanut and minimal woody-smokey character; another miracle from Dogfish Head!
Tap at Stouts Pub. Deep brown with a thin tan ring. Dark chocolate, alcohol, prunes, sawdust and wet stone aromas. Fairly sweet with a dry alcohol, mineral flavor. Heavy body with fine carbonation.
Lovely aroma of roast, malt, chocolate, wood. Lovely beer, black with tan head. 12 oz chug in 5 seconds. Smooth beer, nice chugger, full flavor, full boost, chocolate, wood, roast, yum.

Sweet, cant-like notes, caramel, slightly woody. Also some fruits, raisins, marzipan, maltiness, oaky and boozy. ABV warming is slightly noticeable down the throat. In overall very sweet, boozy, candy-like cocktail.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a nearly opaque black color topped by a large frothy tan head. Nose is dark dried fruit, soy sauce and prunes. Intensely flavored, with notes of dark chocolate, prune juice, soy sauce, dried Montmorency cherries, cold pressed coffee and sweet wood(?). Big alcohol notes as the brew warms. Soft silky mouthfeel. Chewy, cloying finish. Quite tasty and certainly unique.

Nice dark brown with medium brown head. Aroma is dark fruit, fig, plum, raisin, intense malt, hints of cocoa. Taste is chocolate, a most milky, sweet, then a hop bite that comes in, snaps and disappears, leaving sweetness, then alcoholet and dark fruit (like a liqueur on the finish) . Mouthful is heavy, creamy, rich. A luxuriant sipper.

12oz bottle at home courtesy of Saeglopur. No obvious BB date. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells boozy, light cheese, liqueurish, dried fruits, light sherry, wood, bit milky, light cherry notes. bit weird but still decent smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes alcohol, glueish, rather strong on the cardboard, bit sherry, spices, peppery, overly ripe fruits, malt liqueur like, dried fruits, some raisins, nutty, marzipan, light wood. finishes lightly alcoholic with notes of marzipan, raisins, light cardboard and peppery notes. not a bit fan of this one. bit of a booze bomb with some off flavours that lacks balance.

Bottle ( from beergium), Pours dark brown-black with brownish head. The head stays for a long time. Aroma is sour, fruits, strawberries, malt. Flavor is sweet and sour, wood, oak, booze, fruits, berries, strawberries, booze, roast, malt, sugar cherriies maybe. Overall: more beer cocktail than proper beer, but I really like it. Nice sipper.

35,5 cl - Bottled on 11/11/2010
Almost no head, roasty flavour. Complex, silky mouthfeel. Very close to a stout.

Draft. Dark Brown, nearly black. Mega-malty (roast malts, caramel, toffee, candy sugar, vanilla, some chocolate, wood). Mega-fruity (dried fruits, raisins, berries). Spicy. Very very sweet malty and fruity. Good, but too sweet for me. (2008)

A  brown ale aged on the wood of the Palo Santo tree from Paraguay. 

This beer pours dark brown, almost black with a two finger high, brown, creamy head. 

Nose: Caramel malt, chocolate, wood, roasted malt, soy sauce and molasses. 
Taste: Caramel, but, brown sugar, wood and alcohol. 
Mouth: Full body, Smooth and complex texture. Soft and creamy. 

A beautiful beer!

Almost inky black with a tan head that thins quickly. Caramel, chocolate, molasses, malt and cedar wood on the nose. The palate is fat, unctuous, smooth and pleasant. This is a big beer. Its heady and slightly sweet. Personally I would make it a tad more bitter but this, while not my type of beer, is very fine indeed. Careful with the 12% alcohol.

09/2015 bottle from West Side. Pours a deep brown with a tiny beige head that dissipates quickly. Brown sugar, molasses, wood and coffee nose. Fudge brownies with caramel, pretty rich mouthfeel. Cacao & brown sugar finish with a hint of vanilla and caramel. Where is the 12%? This is way too smooth. Great effort from DFH!
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

On tap @ Coopers. pours dark thick inky brown with thick mocha head that laces heavily. Aroma is heavily roasty dark chocolate malt, big woody/oaky flavor, port, soy sauce. Taste is clean big roasty chocolately malt, dry dank woody flavors, rich soy sauce lingers on the finish. Unique beer, really unlike anything else out there. As expected from Dogfish. Ill admit too, the unusual wood does add something here.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Plum Market. Jet black. Bitter aroma. Chocolate. Vanilla-licorice. Very smooth. Subdued alcohol. Cocoa. Mild resin. Great.

APARIENCIA: de color marrón intenso casi casi casi negro, tenues destellos cafés a contraluz en la parte superior; corona de espuma color beige de mediana retención, con burbujas compactas y algunas abiertas, además de algunos alcohol legs en la copa.

AROMA: dulce, notas a caramelo quemado, toffee, vainilla, ligeramente la madera ahumada, frutos oscuros como ciruela y pasas, chocolate dulce.

SABOR de entrada dulce, las notas de vainilla dominan, atrás algo del caramelo quemado y ligeramente toffee, en medio el sabor de la madera ahumada, tenue pero presente, amargor como de un café americano, y de manera más discreta frutos oscuros como pasas y ciruela además de chocolate dulce. En el retrogusto queda un amargor medio, nuevamente como si fuera un café americano, con buena persistencia de sabores tostados, ahumados y dulces como vainilla.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio con sensación sedosa en boca, baja carbonatación. El alcohol no se siente a pesar de la graduación, apenas una sensación cálida en garganta al pasar el trago, y eso cuando la cerveza toma más temperatura.

RESUMEN: buena cerveza con presencia de los tanques de madera en el cual se añejó.

2015 BJCP Category: 33A Wood-Aged Beer (base style: 19C American Brown Ale)
AROMA: Sweet cherry-like aroma of wood and vanilla. Strong dark malt presence; no hops; some alcohol. 9/12APPEARANCE: Opaque dark black hue (rather than brown proper). Moderate dark tan foamy head leaves decent lacing. 2/3FLAVOR: Standard brown ale base of dark malts with no roasted/burnt flavors. Slight caramel and nutty flavors throughout with raisin and other dried fruit presence, too. Hop presence is quite strong due to freshness of bottle. Hops provide earthy flavor and assertive bitterness. Wood emerges on the finish with a slight vanilla flavor in the aftertaste. Alcohol is mostly a background note. 16/20MOUTHFEEL: Full bodied with a smooth, soft texture. Medium carbonation. Doesnt feel sticky nor slick. The 12% ABV alcohol warmth is present, but not distracting. 4/5OVERALL IMPRESSION: An impressive brewing feat of an imperialized brown ale and wood-aging. This is not nearly as sweet and complex as I remember. Might be better with some age. 8/10TOTAL SCORE: 39/50

Vom Fass im Brauhaus. Kastanienfarbenes Bier, cremiger hellbrauner Schaum. Es riecht nach Malz und Brot mit deutlicher Fassnote. Der Geschmack ist holzig und schwer. Cremiges Mundgefühl. Etwas Rauch im Abgang.

Pours a slick, oily black as the dead of night. Nice short creamy head. Not overtly aromatic, but managed to whiff notes of bourbon, wood, and dark toffee. Hints of vanilla bean and dark roast coffee. Rich mouthfeel and lingering sweetness (not cloying or anything) on the finish. Makes for a fine post-dinner sipper by the fireplace on a cold, rainy night. Very enjoyable.

Blackberry log, Bottle pours a brown color with creamy medium sized khaki head. Smell is toffee and dark fruit. Flavor has a lot of the same dark fruit like plum, fig, and grape with some caramel, booze, licorice and perfume. Medium to fuller mouthfeel. Slow sipper

On tap in Greenville, SC. 
Opaque dark brown body with a decent beige head.
A generous amount of dark roasted grains helps this achieve partially hidden alcohol.
Alcohol is obvious, but not quite harsh, in the feel, and the flavor is more than a touch boozy: just enough to hur my ratings on both dimensions.
Pours a very dark brown with a short-lived tan head. Smoked meat on the nose. Thick mouthfeel. Smoked meat comes across prominently in the flavor as well.
Pours dark dark brown with a cocoa head. The aroma is really oaky. A really smooth beer. Its a very distinctive, oaky flavour with licorice and smoke also.

Rating #2160 - 2015.11.10 - Bottle from BevMo. Bubbly boozy amber pour with a decent white head. Aroma is citrusy hops and charred wood chips. Palate gathers most of this up, lots of toffee malt, citrus, pine, and a decent amount of a cedary-like dryness. Tasty.

Draft to taster at cappys pour opaque black brown with thin tan head. Nose vegetal, soy sauce, raisin, light spicy wood. Taste sweet malt, toffee, caramel, then cedar spice. Light tannin on the finish.

This beer is a deep, deep brown color, like a coffee beer, but tastes so much different than one. I give it high marks in smell because its caramel notes are really easy to identify, and its taste is smooth as hell. Its a LITTLE heavy, but nothing that takes you out of it. This beer is very, very good.

Bottle pours a thick black color with a thin dark brown head and thin but very dense lacing. Smells a bit fruity and malty. Interesting flavor with some cherry and chocolate notes. Sweet and good. The aftertaste grows and lingers but is enjoyable.
Fantastic brown, pours very dark almost black with small caramel brown head. Creamy consistency and smooth to drink. Beautiful earthy flavours.

Dark brown to black colored, almost no dark tan non lasting head. Aroma is of sweet malt, caramel, chocolate, some sugary dark fruit, some apple, bit wood, alcohol. Taste is medium to very sweet malt and caramel, brown sugar, some toffee, roasted malt, light chocolate, bit dark fruits, some herbal notes, medium roasty-hoppy bitterness, alcohol and warming. Medium to full bodied, sticky, soft to flat carbonation. Too sweet for me.
(bottle)

Bottle purchased 5/24/16. Pours an opaque brown with just a hint of a head that has a bit of staying power. The aroma is of dark fruit, malt and some alcohol. Taste is luscious, dark fruit and boozy forward. Really enjoyed the beer!

Bottle, 355ml. Opaque dark brown with a frothy to minimal brown head. Aromas of dried fruits, caramel, wood, spices, alcohol. Robust bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Smooth and creamy. Medium to heavy sweet with low to no bitterness (I dont think this beer has any hops). Delicious malt character into a fiery alcohol finish. Exquisite.

Bottle, 355ml. A dark beer with a small brown head and a red hue. Aroma is of wood, alcohol and dried fruits. Medium to robust bodied with some carbonation. Aftertaste of coffee and dried fruits. Strong malt character with a caramel finish.

BOTTLE. Pure darkness in the pure, a touch oily look with minimal tan head.. Warm booze on the nose, dark fruits & the wood.. Dark malty backbone, some vanilla, dried dark fruit/berry with warm strong finish.. Sourced RW

The high ABV is very detectable. I think I would rate higher if the alcohol flavor wasnt so prominent. Its a beautiful glass of beer..nice dark color with diamond sparkle lacing. The aroma is pleasant. I wouldnt turn down another if offered in the future.

Très noir avec une petite robe marron dense. Larôme à vraiment du bois (!) puis plein de malt torréfié, un peu de mélasse et réglisse. En bouche cest super intense, comme boire de lencre. Cest un peu sucré et très terreux avec plein de malt, un goût que je ne connais pas (le bois?) et une finition dune amertume moyenne.

On tap @ HO1K Beers. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Not much of an aroma. Nice roasted nutty malty flavor with a warm alcohol finish. Alcohol is a little overpowering and detracts somewhat from the flavors. OK but not as good as other Brown ales Ive had.

Alcohol, vanilla and wood aromas on the nose, good but nothing special. The taste and body turn this up to 11. Nutty, semi sweet, moderate bitterness and a trace of sour (not a fan of sour but it works). Superb mouth feel; medium viscosity and not too sticky. Slightly salty, abrupt finish. The best brown ale Ive had and new DFH favorite.. Sam knows.

Pour is an exceedingly dark and condense black brown with a tiny creamy tan head that retains and leaves lacing. Smell is just ripe berries, cold winter snow, sweet malt, and a little bit of wood. Taste is wood forwards, balanced lingering sweetness, and a interesting bouquet of flowers and berries. Long sweetened aftertaste
Barf not my fave. Id rather have tea. Or coffee without sugar. Its bitter.

Strong smooth taste with overaged berries, alcohol and some oak. Pitch black color with small/minimal beige head. Strong, smooth taste with roasted, slightly berries and malts, a hint of vanilla and alcohol. In addition, some wood flavors mix in perfectly. Averagely balanced with ultra-wide taste spectrum and long aftertaste with berries and alcohol. Strong body with low/medium carbonation. Overall, a superb product with great woody twist. A bit more balancing and this would be perfect.
Thick black appearance, strong oak flavor with hints of vanilla and caramel. Smells and tastes fantastic.

Bottle.

A- Tobacco, leather, anise, smoke, jerky.

A- Black color, black liquid, brown head.

T- Leather, tobacco, alcohol, smoke, umani, beef jerky, roasty.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Hot damn this is delicious. With so many ratings it tells me this must be fairly easy to obtain on the East Coast. Another reason living in Nebraska sucks. No access to DFH. This beer is full of complex notes. And to believe the bottle considers it a brown ale.
Bottle. Very deep brown, almost black. Huge, bubbly , brown head. Aroma and taste is like a very fine imperial porter. Nice beer.

Appearance: inky unrelieved black with a short fine light beige head that diminishes rapidly to a thin ring, no lacing. (4/5) Aroma: boozy dried fruit, dark malt, woody perfume. (8/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate bitter. (8/10) Palate: full slightly oily body, moderate carbonation, lingering sticky and warm (verging on hot) finish. (4/5)

I have no idea what the cryptic date code on the bottle (2395 B2 0616) means. Obviously it isnt a brew date in June of 2016, and hot as it is I cant see that being a BB, so your guess is as good as mine. Flavourful and hot, a slow sipper that opens as it warms. Calling it an American Strong Ale here, but its got a lot in common with Quads/Abts. About as subtle as arf a brick in the teeth, but boozy good fun. (16/20)

12 oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a very small tan head. Aroma is sweet, chocolate, heavy roasted malt, wood, and alcohol. Tastes of roasted malt, caramel, booze, chocolate, and has coffee and vanilla notes. Alcohol is noticeable, but less pronounced than might be expected for 12% ABV. Wood flavors become more apparent as it warms. Low carbonation. Thick and oily mouthfeel. Quite good. A nice winter beer that packs a punch.

Aroma: malty, slightly chocolatey; some alcohol notes; Appearance: dark brown with minimal head that dissipates quickly; Taste: also boozy and malty; fairly harsh; improves as you drink more, but thats probably due to the alcohol content; Palate: heavy body with soft carbonation; medium, boozy finish; Overall: pretty good but too harsh for me; might buy again.

Pours a deep dark brown from a bottle. Nose of chocolate, vegetal, flavor similar but with a woodsy character I can only assume is from the wood its aged on. Slightly spicy, not hot spicy, but aromatic spicy. Thick and boozy. Very good beer.

If you love the Dogfish 90 and barrel aging, this is a perfect beer. The color is a dark reddish brown with an exotic aroma that still has rich malt with a bit of pine. The flavor is full and rich, with a hint of bitterness over-powered by gently sweet citrus and hops. This is now my go to beer.

12 oz bottle I received as a Christmas gift. Chilled, Poured in tulip glass. Paper thin brown head. Very little lacing. Beer is extremely dark in color. Aroma is rich with notes of dried fruit, extremely heavy malts, light wood, little bit of spiced like rum. Taste is faintly sweet with a touch of bitterness. Some coffee like acidity. Bold. Heavy. Unique. Alcohol at 12% is definitely present but not over powering. Sorta thicker oily texture. Average to lighter carbonation. Full bodied. Over all a really good beer.
Bottle at home while in Jacksonville. Pours a dark reddy coke colour. Sweet rummy, raisin aroma. Boozy, sweet rum, dark fruit, coke, brown sugar... Big but well balanced, nice heat to it. Good.

355ml bottle. Dark brown color with beige head. Malty aroma, roasted, caramel, chocolate, dark dried fruits, light spicy, wood, alcohol. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily body with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Trembling Madness, York. Very dark, chocolate brown. Thin, sticky, lasting, light brown head. Aroma of treacle. Cake fruits. Rum truffle. Spot of woody booze. Background notes of caramelised peach. Taste is vine fruit sweet. Woody, burnt bitter. Rich mouthfeel, albeit a bit fizzy. Finishes a bit dry and boozy. Ok. Silly price tag, mind you.

Bottle. Wood, chocolate malt, and astringent ash aroma. Dark black with large tan head. Sweet coffee/chocolate malt and moderately strong bitter/astringent lemon peel/pine flavor. Good body with nice balance. The 12% is very well hidden.
Bottle, pours deep dark brown, tan head, oily, roasty rich malt, chocolate, complex and long woody notes, lovely warming alcohol. Full bodied with a long palate. Soft carbonation.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 Restrained aroma in an oily black pour. Huge body is both complex and subtle.  One of the best ways of finishing an afternoons beer tasting for sure.

Pours dark chocolate brown with thin coffee coloured head. Aroma is woody (unsurprisingly), with lots of spiced vanilla. Mouthfeel very smooth, hits with strong flavours of burnt toffee, vanilla, and winter spices (cinnamon and star anise). Light carbonation and strong alcohol warming through the chest. Absolutely sensational beer

A very good unique beer. Pours a deep black with a brown head. Smells of smokiness and vanilla. Taste is very complex, with lots of oak and vanilla, caramel. Great beer. Had on tap at the Lighthouse Beer and Wine Festival in Wilminton, NC.

Brown ale.   
ポーターかみ&

Cervesa molt curiosa i complexa, es mèclen els tocs a licor amb la regalèsia, cervesa per tastar però no pel dia a dia.
Cerveza muy curiosa y compleja, se mezclan los toques a licor con el palo santo, cerveza para catar pero no por el día a día.

The Bottle I am reviewing has been aged one year and poured into a tulip glass. The aroma is wood, roasted malts, alcohol,and some star anise. Taste is wood, roasted malts, alcohol, star anise, and dark fruits. Alcohol warming in the chest.

beige head. coffee coloured. aroma is vanilla, candisugar, boozy, nutty, dried fruits, glue, pear. taste like aroma, roasted malts, ash, bitter chocolate, liquorice with a long bitter sweet finish. dense body, creamy carbonation, some alcoholwarmth in the finish. very smooth and drinks very well for the abv. bottle

Aroma is bourbon barrel, roasted malt, nutty. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head. Taste is barrel, roasted malt, bitter, nice. Mouthfeel is thick, good carbonation and rich. Overall, pretty tasty.

Un bel colore marrone profondo, quasi impenetrabile; la schiuma, di buon livello, fine, color caffelatte, si riduce ad un sottile cappello. Aroma ricco di malto e caramello, insieme alla vaniglia; presenziano anche cioccolato e caffè, con note liquorose (Porto?). In bocca riamane dolce, ben presenti note legnose, date dalla maturazione in botte. Corpo consistente e rotondo, presenta tutta la variabilità delle sensazioni maltate e abboccate; mentre la carbonazione è leggera. Molto beverina, nonostante lalcool (12%); ricca di sapori, intensi di vaniglia e frutti scuri, accompagnati da evidenti note liquorose.

Javoue que je naurais pas deviné ce Palo Santo qui, pourtant, est un bois que je brûle comme encens, de temps en temps : il génère effectivement une odeur fort agréable! Cela dit, la bière est toutefois très réussie! Cest rond, très riche, et on ressent clairement le vieillissement au contact de bois (mais darriver à déterminer la nature du bois, cest une autre histoire...). À laveugle, jy aurais été pour une Porter vieillie en fût de chêne. Le 12% amène un sucre certain, mais rien de désagréable. Très réussie!

Appearance: Dark brown, leaning towards black. Minimal, dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, roasted, coffee, wood. Dark fruit.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted, dark fruit. Slight alcohol, warming.
Bought: Total Wine (Sterling), 355 ml, $3.99
Info: 17/9-2015

Tap at Clubhouse BFD. I had this one a few years back. Pours dark, almost black, tan head. Aroma is as woody as I remember. Tons of smoke on it. Malt and hops come through but the wood and smoke are the center pieces. Flavor is amazing. Oak, sweet malt, dark fruit, smokiness, hops, roasted malt. What a complex beer. Absolutely fantastic.

12 oz bottle. Pours black. Tan head, little lacing. Aroma is booze, past ripe dark fruit, and since this thing was aged on wood and somebody told me so, wood. Flavor is fruity, booze, wood, tobacco, spice, chocolate, coffee. Front-heavy carbonation, but creamy finish. Long, syrupy, battering. This is a beer that kicks your ass, in a really good way. Excellent.
Color oscuro, cabeza densa pero sin mucha consistencia, chocolate, melaza y madera, dulce y suave pero con carácter.

sampled at 2015 Dayton Alefest = Pours black with a thick tan head. Delicate coffee creamy taste with a sweet finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy

High gravity, palo santo wood, I was sold at that. Bottle to snifter. Thick syrupy pour, ephemeral tan head. Aroma bursting with barbecue, pretzel, ripened fruit atop thick caramel and dates. Flavor is smokey out the wazoo, raisiny, medium resin, oily milk chocolate, lingering cacao and coffee. 12% and little to no alcohol presence, heartily blanketed in syrupy smokiness. Sip it slow and thank yourself later.

Viscous deep brown pour (there is a glimmer of light coming through), ring of coffee colored head. Nose is dark malt, hint of spice, wood, and alcohol. Sweet. Middle is wood shavings on the back of the throat, dark malt with molasses and hints of cardamon, coffee, and allspice. Finish is a blanket of sweet fruit and booze. Better than most ports. Have to have this one again.

12 oz bottle. Pours a dark oily brown with a 1 finger dark tan melted ice cream head Lots of toasty malt and alcohol but very balanced. Drinks very smooth. Youd never know its 12 abv. Will definitely cellar this one. Cant wait till next year. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Ive had this a few times and had mixed experiences. Pours dark. Aroma is fruity, vanilla, wood. Taste is coffee, cocoa, wood, booze, tobacco. I dig.
Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown color with a light brown head. Aroma is syrupy, dark fruits, roasted malts. Thick, chewy, boozy, dark fruits. Tasty.

Strong hint of cocoa on the nose. Nice lacing, fades to a thin, cream colored head. Appearance is a bit darker than expected for a brown ale - much closer resemblance to a porter. Long, smooth finish with dark fruit notes and hints of coffee and cocoa. As always, a great beer from Dogfish.

I wanted to age this one, but I just couldnt wait. This one is only about 5 months old. Smells like dark fruit, raisin, coffee, cocoa, some booze and of course, wood. Dark brown with barely any head. What foam the beer does have is tan. Tastes a little sour, with black coffee, cocoa, wood and brown sugar. Hardly any booze in the taste for 12% ABV. Excellent thick and syrupy palate. Very well done from DFH. Unique, bold, high octane but good tasting brew. If aged properly by a more patient person, this beer would probably lose that sour quality and be perfect. As is, its still very good.

The beer pours a deep, dark brown color with a small khaki-colored head that disappears quickly. The aroma contains caramel malts, wood, vanilla, toffee notes; the taste is quite umami, slightly sweet, slightly boozy, and a touch bitter, and the flavors were reminiscent of wood, tobacco, vanilla, and bourbon. Despite the high ABV, this beer was smooth, and its full body, oily and thick texture, and flat carbonation matched the flavors perfectly.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and small brown head. Smell: caramel and malt domination. Spicy notes, finish as vanilla. Taste: very high body, sweet and caramel. Woody notes and spicy. Small alcohol finish. Aftertaste: dry malt and caramel with alcohol notes.

Tulip glass; pours deep brown with a tan head. Lacing present on the glass throughout the drink. Aroma of vanilla bean, coffee, chocolate, toffee, and booze. Taste is loads of vanilla, woody malt and more booze. This beer is very good, but I feel like at somewhere between 8-10% instead it couldve been great.

Nose -- you can really smell the wood, caramel, nuttiness and alcohol. Just a tiny hint of smokiness. Poured super dark and super thick. Didnt think it would be like this. The alcohol is really upfront with the woodiness, caramel, sweet malt and a bit of bitter. Finish is alcohol. Really great and I will pick up more.
Decent beer, but strong, so strong it makes me want do crazy stuff like listen to old ABBA records and dance naked in the kitchen. I think Ill have another please.

Single bottle to tulip. Dark brown pour with a thin, slightly pinkish head. Vanilla, caramel, bourbon, and wood, and booze in the aroma. Flavor matches - the wood notes are a little much, but the sweetness knocks the woodiness back a little bit when it warms up a bit. Bitter coffee finish and aftertaste. Very creamy/full-bodied mouthfeel.
Chocolately, dark fruit and vanilla aroma. The taste is a little dominated by vanilla. Vanilla, chocolate and dark fruit.

Bottle into fancy stout glass. Thick tan head on a hard pour. Black. Aroma of molasses, raisins and wood. Slick full mouthfeel that hides alcohol. Taste similar to aroma, hints of vanilla, some sweetness but also finishes dry w mild hop bitterness. Solid beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark brown color; small , beige head. Aroma of malt , caramel , vanilla and wood. Sweet malty taste with notes of roasted caramel , vanilla , dark fruits and hint of alcohol. Good , dessert beer .
Very sweet scent, extremely dark and thick color. This was aged for two years by my friend, so it's probably much smoother than a fresh one, but excellent flavor
very good slight (vanilla?) sweet smell that smells high in alcohol, taste is high alcohol with bit of licorice...slightly bitter finish...very bold and "hot"...hurts it though :(

Pours dark with a bit of foam. Aroma is woody, something interesting going on, library bookshelf? Tastes really rich, full of chocolate, bitter one with not too much cocoa. Booze bites a bit and leaves beautiful long lasting aftertaste.
Couleur noire aux reflets bruns avec un mince col qui se dissipe lentement. Aromes de torrefactions, cafe, chocolat noir, fruits rouge, bois, alcool, tres licoreux. A boire tranquilement.

Draft at Dogfish Head Fairfax. Pours dry dark brown with a fizzy tan head. Tastes like booze, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, and woody malt. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like dark chocolate, booze, caramel, woody malt, and light earth.

Very unique. Bottle pours Very dark brown with one finger persistent tan head. Aroma Palo Santo and malts. Taste matches with wood, vanilla, roast malts and other spices I cant identify which I guess are coming from the Palo Santo. Almost a cinnamon/nutmeg sensation. Creamy palate with woody finish.

Pours black with brown head. Roasted, oaked, chocolate, toffee. Full bodoed, some residual sweetness. Nice balance. Finishes with coffee after taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black dark tan head. Aroma is malty, fruiy. Some alcohol. Taste has prunes, roastiness and warming alcohol.
Pours dark brown with a thin tan head. Aromas of caramel and vanilla with a similar flavor.
My first dogfish head beer and I am not a fan at all. Drain pour extravaganza.

Silky mouthfeel woodshop sandpaper & leather aroma
Shadows of dark fruit,
Nice black body with brownish head. Nose is chocolate, coffee, and caramel. Taste also of chocolate, dark fruits too and caramel. Nice creamy texture. Very good.

One of the best Dogfish Head beers ever. This one is a slooow sipper. This beer is extremely complex and changes as you drink it. It pours like the most beautiful imperial stout. Pitch black with gigantic chocolate and roasted aroma. Subtle coffee and caramel toffee as well. Theres an undeniable whiskey aroma here and it really stands out as this beer warms up. The taste is big and bold and in your face with so many complex flavors. You get a massive amount of whiskey, vanilla, chocolate and coffee taste. Really delicious. This is a big beer and you can feel it but its not overwhelming but its definitely there. You can see where the lines cross between a roasty brown ale and a big malty imperial stout. I really enjoyed this beer and Dogfish Head is one of those breweries that definitely has some intimidating beers and this is no exception but this is one of the best, if not best beer they brew. Im going to feel this one soon. Cheers!

Pours pitch black with a tan head. Nose is chocolate and coffee, caramel. Flavor is plum, dates, dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla, a touch of woody spice. Lovely and warming, with a heavy body and slightly oily mouthfeel. Decadent, delicious. I dont get loads of wood, but maybe Im not looking hard enough. Lovely beer.

Pours black with a frothy tan head. Aroma of dark malt, chocolate, dark fruit and wood. Taste is malty, a bit toasty along with some nuttiness, fruit and light hops. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium body.
Dont go in thinking this is a brown. Dont think its a stout either. Its a chimera of sorts. sexy and deep. Reddish black Brown. Hard and hella high abv for such a little bottle.

RATED 5/22/2009- Bought a 4-pack of this about a year ago. Had a single aging in the fridge since then, so just opened it up now to sample while I review. Has a VERY strong fruity/oakey aroma with a smokey finish, almost like wine. Dark dark coffee brown, pretty much black appearance. So thick doesnt really have a head, but has a decent amount of carbonation. Tastes of oak, chocolate, fruits, spices, sugar, malts, hops....very yummy. Could be the best beer that I have had...if not then top 3-5.

(Dogfish Head Palo Santo Marron) Bottle 355 ml at home,bottled 11/2013, served into a snifter. ABV 12%
Black coloured body, one finger of dark brown head, with good density and retention, leaving light lacing behind.
Aroma of vanilla, chocolate, toffee, caramel, light alcohol, prunes.
Great taste. Lots of dark fruits, prunes, sweet caramel, chocolate, malts, vanilla, quite boozy, roasted malts.
Thick body, notable carbonation, sticky on the palate. Smooth mouthfeel.
Very good, in spite of the sharp alcohol.

Draft. Black color with dark tan head and minimal lacing. Chocolate aroma. Chocolate flavor with slight alcohol in the finish. Heavy mouthfeel and consistency. Overall, more characteristic of a porter or stout than a brown ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a medium sized dark brown head. Malty nose with some chocolate, wood, brown sugar. Flavour has quite some barrel with cedar like notes coming through. Also cocoa, brown sugar, dark dried fruits, vanilla, light charcoal, Full body, warming alcohol, soft carbonation, some sweetness but balanced by bitterness and alcohol. Just short of being over the top for my taste, I like this ok as a sipper; the alkiehol isnt too aggressive and the mouthfeel is fairly soft.

Black pour, khaki head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and oak. Taste is chocolate, coffee and wood pulp. Very thick and oily. Palo Santo wood adds nice backbone to complex flavors. Very good and well built beer.
Une brown ale avec un arome enorme de fruit cuit on dirait une biere vieillie dans un fut de porto ou madere.

Bottle. Black pour. Thin tan head. Big aroma of coffee chocolate vanilla oak dark fruit. Complex taste of all those. Rich but not too sweet lovely smooth mouthfeel. Handles the 12% alcohol very well with just a nice back if throat warmth. It is up there with the best.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours hazy amber with a little sediment and a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are tropical fruit, grapefruit, and pine - with a bitter finish.

No light getting through this dark, thick beer. One finger thick light-brown head formed then dissipated with virtually no lacing along the glass. 

The body of this brew is almost like that of a stout. Smells of some chocolate, molasses, some sweet dark malts, nuts, possibly caramel, and of course of vanilla. 

Truly divine flavor and taste of coffee, chocolate, caramel, molasses, toffee, dried fruits and vanilla. 

This slick, smooth, mouth feel may be quite possibly amazing amongst the subtle carbonation. 

Overall, this was an awesome concoction that I cannot wait to savor again! Stored a couple away for next time. Highly recommended!!!
Bottle. Pours black with thin tan head. Nose is soy, dark fruits, raisins, alcohol. Taste is similar with some alcohol burn. Creamy mouthfeel.

Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasty, alcohol, 
Appearance black, brown foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate full body, thick feel, 
Overall I would suggest this beer to someone who likes big beers
Shared bottle, dark black colour with a small tanned ring. Dark espresso coffee, cacao, oak, raisins, hints of licorice, dark red fruits, malts, bit of a spicy alcohol burn

Bottle from Waterbury Craft Beer Cellar, thanks Ben. Aroma: caramel, vanilla, roasted coffee, wood. App : pitch black with small frothy beige head. Taste and palate: full creamy body, medium sweetness, finish is fruity (dark red fruits), sweet and warming from the alcohol. Overall: for some reason, I wasn?t expecting this smell and color when I read it was an American strong ale but I was very impress by its taste and palate.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2016 I enjoy the complexity of this beer. Great palate with a balanced flavor profile. Sweet fruit, vanilla, smoked wood, slight floral quality, semi boozy and subtle bitterness in the finish are all delivered within a smooth full mouth feel. A great beer for sipping.
Near black pour with light tan head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee and wood. Taste adds plum. Nice stuff.

Bottle from cellarbrations super store in hami hill. Pours as dark as night with a tiny ring of head. Aroma is pretty intense and complex and reminded me a lot like garage projects umami monster minus the fish. Aroma has some slight chocolate, coffee, smoked bacon, wood and perhaps a slight hint of sea water. it's full bodied with little to no carbonation. Taste is complex much like the aroma. First you get a hit of dark chocolate and vanilla which is then followed by some cherry. It has quite a bitter finish and at the end of the palate you get that hit of roasted peanut and dry wood. Unlike umami monster this leaves a wonderful taste in the mouth. Didn't know much about this beer before I had it and I definitely won't forget how good it was!

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2015 Dark brown with thick brown head. List of woody toffee cherry and booze aroma very nice viscous mouth feel. Starts off boozy dark toast malt like an American strong ale or imperial porter. Quickly followed by an unusual and delicious cherry like boozy woody flavor from the unique wood used in the barrels. I havent had this in a few years and forgot just how great this beer is.

Bottle from ABC. Pours a nearly pitch black with a thin brown head. Lacing is nice as well. Malt aroma for days; burnt molasses, straw, dark bread. A doughy yeast backbone, it seems. Taste is sweet - vanilla and caramel with strong oak flavors and some pretty well-hidden booze. Body is incredibly full with an almost syrupy texture. The alcohol really comes through on the finish. Beginning to really like this beer. Acquire.

Great! Looks like a thick black coffee when poured. Initially the flavour is smokey, which gives way to a rich sweetness and good bitterness.
Hard to find in Australia, and it is $14 a bottle. Amazing beer though.

355ml bottle as a gift from Virginia, USA:
A very nice beer from Dogfish Head once again, this one had an enjoyable taste to it and went down a lot easier than I had imagined going in. The nose could have been a little more pronounced with some notes proving a little difficult to detect but once given some time to open up things started to be a little more noticeable. The alcohol was fairly well hidden with only small amount coming through and the sweetness in the taste was very nice. A great beer overall and definitely one that Id like to try again, hopefully I can get my hands on another bottle somehow.

Bottle shared at Anchorage Jan 15 Tasting:: Poured a dark black/brown with a light brown head. Aroma was vanilla, woodsy, and caramel. Taste is carbonated, sweet caramel, vanilla, and some wood. A light alcohol burn, just lively to the mouth not over powering.

Bottle. Black, brown tan head. Chocolate, milky vanilla brown malty nose. From the aroma already its pretty clear its going to be an intensive drink. Full bodied, soft wonderfully smooth texture. Malty chocolate, some wood. Doesnt feel too oaked though (a good thing), just lovely smooth malty. After a couple of sips I do feel a bit of an alcohol burning in the back of my throat, but have no idea how it sneaked there..

Dogfish Head Palo Santo Marron doesnt live up to the hype for me. Dark brown pour with a thin head that doesnt last. Very light aroma of malt. Taste is very boozy with notes of mostly bourbon with subtle hints of wood. Not a lot of compexity. For me, Palo Santo Marron was just big booze bomb.

OK this is my first and only 5/5 score so far. I have always been against giving a perfect score to a beer/wine/meal but I think this one totally deserves it. May sounds weird, but I had it with a medium-spiced chili con carne. I was in Heaven! The beer is not spicy at all. Nose of woods,vanilla, coffee and a bit of smoke in the end. Taste is woody just as the nose, a litle sweetness, dark fruits, whiskey. This is so complex! I have no words to describe this. Sorry to leave you guys, but I got to lay back a moment to enjoy this magnifiscient beer in this very moment. Cheers!

Smells great, smoke and dark malt. Not overly complex but rich aroma. Looks great, very dark with long lasting brown head. Tastes great, vanilla and sweet malt upfront, woody and smoky notes to finish. A bit of cherry and sweetness round out the finish. Great and interesting beer. Super silky smooth, average carbonation.

Bit of an alcohol aroma but rather smooth on the tongue. Earthy and chocolatey, with a bit of oaky bite

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
[ölprovning med Rydis, januari 2015] fantastisk arom, mycket chocklad. EXKTREMT bra balans
Arômes de bois, de vanille, de caramel et de chocolat avec une pointe dalcool. En bouche un corps moyen avec un assemblage de saveurs semblable au nez. Excellent
Not much aroma for me. A bit of brown sugar. Dark brown, dissipating tan head. Flavor is bitter chocolate, vanilla, some booze and cola. Sticky mouthfeel. Nice sipper.
Bottle from saveur-biere.com. Nice dark brown color. Medium brown head. Body is super smooth. Medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is chocolate, wood, light roasted.

bottle. Pours black with an average-sized brown head. Somewhat roasty aroma with some booziness. Somewhat sweet in flavor with roasty notes and a bit of alcohol warming. Smooth on the palate with a warm sweet finish. Very good.

A very dark brown color and a small light brown head. A nice aroma of raisins and banana. The first that hit me was the thickness of the brew in the mouth, but at the same time it is well carbonated. The taste has some sweetness resembling that of liqourice, raisins and prunes, and a decent bitterness as well. Great heavy beer in my opinion!

Roasty, malt aroma. Appearance is jet black with a tan head that dissipated quickly. Chocolate malt flavor with notes of toast and roast that lingers on the end. Bitterness level is moderate. Wood notes are evident, but more in the background. Mouthfeel is full with medium carbonation with a slight astringency on the end. Overall, it's a good beer that hides the alcohol well. It could use more malt complexity though. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap @ Plonk. Dark, dark brown. Aroma and taste and dark and complex. Roasty, woody, fruity. Tasty!
Absolutely loved this! Deep, dark and rich, velvety smooth. Nutty, smoky , woody, some chocolate notes. Warmth without burn. Id like to get my hands on more of this

3 year-old bottle, 13/8/13. Pours unclear rich brown, not much head. Smells of rich layers of malt, raisins, some red vinous notes, spice. Tastes very sweet, some toasty roastiness, prunes, smooth buttery vanilla oak, xmas spice. Little to no hop character, just the faintest whiff of bitterness. Heavy, thick, sticky, low carbonation. This was delicious and complex but pretty difficult to drink.
Beautiful color. Great aroma. Perfect amount of kick. Best served (for my taste) just below room temperature, in a sniffer.
Very fascinating beer with an aggressive woodiness, fruity character, sweet with hints of molasses. Complex and unique beer.
This is a strongly alcoholic beer that uses malts to overpower its way into your mouth. You can smell the roast flavor and tastes like a wine would.

Very complex taste. A bit of sweet and bitter with a thick finish. Definitely a beer for a cold day and worth trying. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One year old bottle. Pours dark, opaque chestnut brown with brown head. Nose is booze, dark fruit and sweet malt. Flavour is really unique and tasty. I get a definite strawberry note, mixed in with complex roasty, fruity, sweet flavours. Remarkably smooth for its heft. Never tasted anything quite like this and I like it.

Bottle from a trade. Thanks Kump! Dark brown/black colour, dark brown foam. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, coffee, wood and vanilla. Also fruity notes of berries. Sweet with bitter aftertaste . Very good.

Flaske: Brunsort uigennemsigtig øl med et lækkert fluffy skumhoved. Dyb duft af sødmefuld malt og trælagring. Smagen er fyldig og meget lækker hvor den specielle træsmag tydelig for lov at skinne. Super øl. Endelig fik jeg den prøvet.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Redwood City, CA. Pours a deep soy sauce. Aroma is sweet, roasted malts, dark liqueur. Medium thick body. Swirls of dark fruits, roasted malts, and booze. Very warming but overall a bit too sweet and boozy, otherwise I would have loved this.

Very rich roasted flavor. The bottle calls it a brown ale but it is black as night and much more intense than any other brown ale Ive had. Can tell how potent it is, the alcohol stands out. Definitely worth grabbing one occasionally.

Bottle dated 2/4/14 poured into a snifter..dark brown with a thin white head..aroma of booze,wood,caramel,vanilla..medium carbonation but nice dry crisp finish..boozy but good..can really taste the woody,caramel texture.

Pours a dark black with brown head. A coffee and look ght roasted cocoa aroma. A creamy texture with coffee, chocolate, roast malts, and dark liquor taste. A lingering malt, dark alcohol, and coffee aftertaste.

12 oz glass.
Dark heavy body. Almost no head. Big complex flavors. Fig, prune, vanilla, dark fruit, smoke. Heavy roasted coffee,with some subtle spices, some brandy on a slightly boozy finish. Extra long finish, sweet but not too sweet.

On tap at HopCat in East Lansing. The pour is a pretty decent black with a nice khaki ring of head and no lace. The aroma is big on barrel character with vanilla and a little woodiness. There is also a nice malty complexity that I love. The flavor is a little more balanced. There is a nice bourbon note at the front and solid barrel throughout. The malts and caramel really pop on the back end and it's pretty good. The mouth feel is a bit thin, not a whole lot of carbonation leading off to a mild somewhat roasty aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pris a New york ramené de Virginie, effluves de café,chocolat noir , notes de fruits rouges confits, de noisette brulé. assez difficile a percevoir comme nez.En bouche c,est très doux, il y a du gros café,cest sur, mais en générale cest bien fait pas trop lourde, avec une belle chaleur en final, beaucoup de noix, ont dirait même des notes de porto.Apaise les angoisses. super bonne

September 25, 2014. Bottle at SBWF. Pours dark brown with a creamy brown head. Aroma is wood, vanilla, coffee, light ash, dark fruits. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter chocolate, finish has roasted coffee and alcohol. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

12 oz bottle from Giant Eagle in Pittsburgh. This is one of the best browns youll find anywhere. Something in here makes it exceptionally great. Maybe its the wood, maybe the high alcohol content. No matter what, dont miss out before its gone.

The board says its 14% and 35 IBUs. Pours deep brown with a nice frothy brown head. Aroma of wood mulch, nutshells, and caramel. Soft carbonation in the mouthfeel. Initial brown ale flavor of brown sugar and caramel, some hints of cocoa, but then it quickly gets overpowered by the alcohol. Warming and dry woody flavor on the finish. Boy, this beer had a lot of alcoholic kick to it. I am not sure a brown ale is meant to have this type of ABV, as it really overpowers the beer. The wood aging definitely helped pull this together.

A Dogfish Head főzeteiben ha akarnék, sem tudnék csalódni, nem is volt ez másképp ezzel a típussal sem. Külleme elemi erőről árulkodik, rikítóan fekete színe és bézs habja festményeket idéz. Ősereje az aromák terén is beigazolódni látszik; ha a túlérett gyümölcsök aszalványait brandyben és whiskyben áztatnánk, majd nemes fa füstjén pörkölnénk meg kissé, ezt követően pedig csokoládé-vanília fagylalt legjavában hempergetnénk meg, akkor kapnánk valami hasonló végeredményt. Tovább nem is ragozom. Az a fajta ital, ami teret enged a tapasztalásnak, korlátoktól mentesen indulhatunk el az ízlelés ösvényén, majd minden korty alkalmával szakíthatunk egyet az utunkat szegélyező termésekből. Az olyan exkluzív adalékok, mint a paraguayi Palo Santo fán történő érlelés megtette a hatását; stílusos és kifinomult ízvilágát körülöleli egy klasszikus eleganciát biztosító fahordós karakter, amelyből aztán vaníliás, dohányos, prémium kategóriás alkoholok jegyei szűrődnek ki, hogy ezekhez sejtelmesen csatlakozzon egy jótékony imperial stoutos, kávés-étcsokoládés karakter annak földes jellemvonásaival, majd egy mogyorós, diós, pirított magvas szerkezet az édeskés hangulatokat magán hordozva.
Delicious, thick, flavorful, unique. Complex vanilla, cocao, Smokey flavor. A little earthy.

Sample at SBWF 2014. Black beer with a decent beige/brownish head. Roasted caramel aroma, vanilla, oak, woody, raisins, hoppy notes, cocoa, toffee, some discreet spices. Roasted fruity flavor, figs, raisins, caramel, licorice, chocolate, warming alcohol, banana notes, cocoa, some plums. Very nice!

355mL bottle Bottled 04/24/14
Wow! Cant get over how thick this stuff pours, like a pale sump oil-looking liquid making its journey into the glass. 
Aroma is rich, fortified wine-like, with plenty of raisins, dried fig, dark chocolate, burnt nuts, thick dark toffee, seared red meat character, charred oak, and an almost rancio-like aged character you tend to get with older beers.
The stuff is properly thick, not just syrupy, not just oily, but chewable, with a low carbonation accentuating this.
Big flavours on the palate with bucket loads of browned caramel, charred nutty wood, dried fruits, earthy leafy hop, cocoa - so much going on! Solid bitter note on finish, booze is warming, not shy but welcoming.
Completely different from anything Ive yet encountered - an old ale, meets an imperial stout, wood aged but not specifically oak, so its a whole new ball game. Fantastic stuff!

Definitely blurs the line between strong ale and stout. Coffee and Roma wine on the nose. Booze apparent on the palate running into a nice wine and plum with bitter dark chocolate. Delicious and definitely too easy to drink.

Pours black with a brown head. Chocolate, malt, caramel, toffee, wood, molasses and dark fruit aroma. Chocolate, wood, soy sauce, tobacco, dark fruit, malt, caramel and licorice flavors. Full body and average carbonation. Semi-dry chocolate, wood and dark fruit finish.
2008 bottle side by side with a 2014. Pours black with brown head. Sweet with a big roasted malted finish.

Really good beer! I was really impressed with taste, smell, palate ...
Idefinitely suggest that you try it just more than one time.

Faint nutty brown oaty vibe. Vibrant woody redcurrant nose. Initial taste of juicy bright malt, floral and oaky. Warming mouthfeel without being sticky or rich. Sweet burn on the finish.Bottle, Tasting by Numbers Tasting
Bottle, thanks Craig. Dark brown with tan head. Aroma Of licorice, chocolate and oak. Taste of fruity wood, molassea and chocolate. Full bodied, rich and sweet.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours dark brown, nose is raisins, dry roast, taste is sweet, fruity, tasty.

This is one fine beer. Pours black with mocha head that leaves a ring around the glass. Aromas are campfire, meat, vanilla and then port. Chewy mouth feel. Vanilla and dried fruit, port, some booze. Great stuff.
Really roasty and some vanilla. Subtle aroma with a bolder flavor. Try it soon

12 fl oz bottle thanks to Axel (non-ratebeer), sampled in Ludvika on August 26, 2014.Black color, small teal head. Sweet, spicy, alcohol scent. Sweet, fruity, alcohol taste. Alcohol, fruity aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, medium bitterness.
Beautiful beer. Smell and taste very complex dark fruit, wood, coffee, and bitter chocolate. High alcohol doesnt overwhelm but is warming.
12oz bottle poured into a tulip glass, black...somewhat thin for the ABV, with a small light tan head. Nose is great! Very complex, can definitely pick up the wood.
Aged in a barrel made of Paraguan wood. I really love how strong this beer is.
Super dark. Strong booziness and lots of raisins. Goes down nicely with those dark fruit tones and woodiness.

Transfer from BA review on 9-12-12-
 Poured from bottle into snifter

 Appearance  Pours a nearly black color with a small one finger tan head. The head fades quite fast to leave a light level of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is sweet and boozy. A strong dark fruit aroma of raisin, grape, and prune are big and bold matched only by a good wiff of alcohol. Mixed with these aromas are some lighter aromas of a woody nature as well as some smells of vanilla and some roasted malt and chocolate. Overall quite robust and delicious.

 Taste  The beer is not as sweet as would have been detected from the nose. While not as sweet as expected it is as boozy as would be expected from the nose. The taste begins with a lightly fruit sweetened taste with a big roasted malt and a dark bready taste. As the taste moves on, a woody and oaky flavor comes to the tongue with some lighter tastes of vanilla and a bourbon like alcohol taste. While the alcohol is lighter in the middle of the taste it gains strength as the flavors move on. In the end the alcohol is rather strong; leaving a warming and light oaky bourbon burn on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The beer is thick and creamy in body with a lower to medium level of carbonation. Its thick body suits well the very warming nature of the beer.

 Overall  Pretty boozy but it is nice and warming and has some wonderful flavors. This is definitely a sipping beer.
Could be the best smelling beer of all time. Great up front malt and fruit tastes. Love the lingering sweetness. This is a new favorite for me. Too bad I cant get it all of the time.

Bottle sample at American Strong Ale tasting at Beer&Beyond, Tel Aviv. Dark black with low quickly diminishing brown head. Unique floral aroma, soapy, woody, smoked, very rich. Very sweet flavor, floral, soapy, woody, date honey, vanilla, chocolate, notes of coffee, balanced. Oily texture. Light carbonation. Full body. Sweet coffee aftertaste.

A very dark brown beer with a quite weak and beige head. The aroma is unique, complex and powerfull, great. Liquirice, dark fruits, aromatic wood, nuts and chocolate. Taste has rich and balanced malts, some caramell and liquirice, aromatic wood. Almost full bodied, easy to drink, nice. Alcohol cannot taste and its gives only the strenght and richness, great. Very unique beer, where the complex flavours mix to nice balance. Enjoyable. Complex. Good.

Extremely good. Great mix smoke with some roast and a nice dose of citrus hops. Dark chocolate and light booze. Medium bitter finish. Pours murky brown with decent head and lacing l. Tap at Rehoboth Beach brewpub.

Dogfish Head Santo Marron has a thin, cream-colored head, a extremely dark-brown (essentially black) appearance, with noticeable, fierce bubbles streams at the side of the glass. There is a lacing sheen left behind. Aroma is super-sweet, full, syrupy, and of alcohol. Taste is of dark-roasted, very sweet, syrupy barley malt, a background wood note, subdued hop bitterness, and even molasses, I think. Mouthfeel is rather heavy, with an underlying chalkiness (which I perceive as a flaw). Dogfish Head Santo Marron finishes mostly wet and very boozy. RJT

Une brown de luxe! Un nez de bonbons a la réglisse noire, pomme compotées, d'alcool et de sucre. Le goût est tellement riche et enveloppant. Des goûts amère de chocolat se développe en bouche. On sent aussi l'alcool et le sucre. La finale est ronde et persistante. On sent plus a la fin la torréfaction des grains. Une belle surprise d'un ami !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sweet, dark chocolate flavor. Nice cover for the abv. On tap at Lowes foods. Very nice overall.

This beer has a wonderfully inviting aroma of almost a red wine. It has a smokey woody flavor and a beautiful black color with a brown sugar colored head. I like it very unique. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a deep dark brown with a very thin carmel head. Aromas of soy, nice deep sour red fruits, alcohol, roasted malt, coca. Taste is a unique malt profile with roast, followed by sweetness and a light booze note finish. Very unique taste for a brown. After a few sips there is a coca/molasses taste

12oz bottle. Dark brown pour with a frothy brown head. Flavors are smoked wood, cocoa powder, roasted malts, maple syrup, burnt brown sugar, molasses, licorice, cherries and alcohol. Full body, soft carbonation, creamy texture.

12oz bottle. Pours dark chestnut with maroon foam. Oaky/woody nose with lots of booze. Taste: Roasty notes up front, heavy booze and finishes with chocolate and vanilla notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It has an almost opaque dark brown body with lighter chestnut highlights near the edges of the glass. The pour is deep, dark and thick, making a small light brown head to sit on top. This head fades out quickly however and leaves a thin ring of tan foam lace. A quick swirl gives it a wispy thin film covering and slick lace. The aroma has toasted bready malt, roasted grain, sweet brown sugar and molasses. This gives it a sweet overall character but there is also some fresh cut pine, resin, hops, dark wood and leathery notes. Its alcohol is noticeable as well. There is a lot of complexity here in this big full bodied beer. There are sweet notes of brown sugar, vanilla, molasses, raisons, and prunes. This is balanced with some floral/woody notes, pine resin, leafy hops and dark hard wood. It also has notes of toasted bread, roasted grain and warm alcohol that give it a bit of bite. This all comes on a heavy, slightly viscous texture with smooth carbonation.
Tap at brewery. Black pour. Wood, medicine, caramel, oak, vanilla. Big body. Almost creamy coffee and vanilla body. Good carbonation to balance out the big body. Great

355ml bottle from Saveur Biere


Deep black colour with a beautiful brown head. Aroma of chocolate, tree bark and winegum. Excellent full-bodied taste and mouth-feel. Alcohol feels in palate but not disturbingly. Superb dessert beer for slow sipping.
Wood aged brown ale beer with lots of chocolate and caramel flavour with a hint of vanilla, this would have scored higher with me had they called it a stout or porter
Bottle shared with seb@ saint bock A: chocolate, woody, brown sugar, licorice. App: pitch black beige head. T/p: full body with sweet and moderate long sweet finish. O: great. I like overall balance.

Pours a dark brown, almost black, with little head but nice lacing. Sweet malty, caramel on the nose. A creamy mouthfeel with alcohol on the tongue. Vanilla, caramel, and alcohol throughout. A very good, somewhat wacky brown ale.

Riche, bien noire, elle présente une mousse rare et une texture huileuse, lourde. En nez, vanillée et chocolatée à la fois, avec un peu de café et de fruits confits, sans doute dû au bois. Lalcool est très fort en bouche, le sucre aussi, mais la décadence est agréable. Crémeuse et douce, bien quagressive. Une offrande très solide de DFH,

Reviewed from notes.
Ive had this in a pint glass several times but once in a tulip. There wasnt any differences.
The appearance was basically a ruddy brown color with a nice one finger white foamy head that dissipates at a decent pace leaving some nice lacing.
The smell was basically like a woody Brown Ale with some light vanilla and booze features. 
The taste was basically the same. 
On the palate, it sat about a medium on the body with a nice smooth slightly creaminess running about my mouth and tongue. 
Overall, I say this was a nicely done Strong Ale.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown almost black ink color. Thick long standing dark brown head with heavy lacing. Sweet fruity aroma. Deep roasted malt flavor on the front with a sweet finish that has a distinct alcohol finish. Very well done, Dogfish Head!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

09-JUN-2014, bottle @home, from Kihoskh.
Black with low lasting, tan head.
Aroma is Wood, syrup, raisin, roast, Brown sugar. Earthy, spicy, and slightly minty. Taste the same. Sticky, full body, soft carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle at home. High creamy long lasting and good looking light brown head.. Lovely black body. Mild dusty roasted malt wood aroma. Sweet creamy dried fruit smoke flavor with little hops bitternes, low carbonation and a long sweet finish. Alcohol well hidden.
Pours dark brown. Aroma is dark fruits and vanilla. Taste is sweet and follows the nose.
Woodsy and spicy, very intense aromas. Super oaky. Heavy body. Smooth. Boozy. Dark fruit, sweet - ish.
Aromas of raisin, licorice, cinnamon, oak. Deep dark red-black, with a lasting dark tan head. Dry, spicy, very complex between fruit, earth, and spice flavors. Full bodied. Awesome!

Dark brown pour with almost no head. Smells of herbs, coffee, and a bit of sweetness. Roasted grain flavor and a little bit of caramel with a big boozy finish. This should probably be cellared for a while before drinking to balance the flavors.
Very dark brown with creamy brown head. Aroma is caramel, wood and brown sugar. The taste is roasted caramel, vanilla, cherries, figs. Its sweet and a little boozy.

Pours a very very dark brown -- almost black but with reddish highlights. Little head that disappears quickly. Smoky, alcoholic, slightly oxidized note coming through on the nose (6 months old, stored at room temp). Rich, roasted coffee and warming, sweet alcohol presence. Wood comes through on the end -- sweet charcoal/campfire kinda thing along with a dry alcohol note. Huge body and smooth, medium carbonation.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Bottle (12oz): Dark Beer with very little reddish brown head Strong aroma. I taste roasted coffee and booze. Pretty thick in the mouth. A little sticky too. I do like it very much, but its a sipper and 1 is probably enough. This will be on my regular buy list.
Drought. Inky black with chocolate colored spongy head, nutty aroma, roasted malt taste with alcohol aftertaste, low carbonation. Tingling feeling on your tongue.
Pours a very dark brown with off-white head. Dark fruits, vanilla, cedar/oak, and some roasted character on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes strong.

355 ml bottle shared. Dark brown to black body with a brown head. Aromas of vanilla, chocolate, malts, dark fruits, some alcohol. Taste was malty sweet and pretty mind-blowing. Chocolate, vanilla, molasses, red wine, some plums, alcohol. Sweet aftertaste which stays really long. Full body with low carbonation. Excellent one which will become even better with aging, my guess.

Surprising appearance. Very dark with light brown head. Looks and smells a bit like a porter. Nice flavor of caramel and chocolate. Very strong finish where you can feel the 12% ABV. Another one well done by Dogfish Head.

Not a strong and intense as the Anderson Valley Imperial Stout. Better taste that still very rich and malty. Enjoyed this overall but definitely for the rare occasion. 

Edit; enjoying the flavor. Could have 1-2 of these in an evening. Needs to be sipped and would go well with....?? 

Pours dark.
355ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique on 16/05/14. Great beer stacked full of aroma and flavour. The finish lingers and leaves you wanting more

Boozy aroma of raisin, fig, vanilla, caramel. Appearance is opaque dark brown with a creamy long lasting head. Interesting flavor that I didnt expect from the aroma. I taste a distinct flavor like a spruce tree, probably from the wood it was aged on. This is very unique, I couldnt detect the wood aging in the aroma. A good surprise and nice find.

Aroma- Cherries, raisins, chocolate, booze (but the good kind), caramel, something that reminds me of oats, light smoke, hoppy spice, and vanilla. 

Taste- This is one of those that goes from good to glorious as it warms. Sweet mix of dark fruits in the very beginning. Beautiful combination of coffee, chocolate, and caramel comes next, morphing into wonderful dark roast coffee. Spice, dark chocolate, and coffee aftertaste that fades into a light raisin flavor.

"Bottled on 02/11/08." Dark beer with a thin brown head. Deep rich nose of dried fruit, roasted malts and alcohol. I have not had a fresh one of these, but this is a gorgeous beer with this much age on it. Buttery smooth with nice woody tones, dark caramel, rich fruit cake, salty chocolate, and a gentle alcohol caress. For 12% this is a silent killer. Very nice beer and Im now looking for more to age.

Pours a dark brown without much of a head. Has a very strong wood aroma and flavor. I dont get much else due to how overpowering the wood flavor is, but there is also some sweet caramel and malts. Has a full body feel and goes down smooth. The aroma and flavor are both very powerful. The alcohol presence may be a tad high, but this is one delicious ale.
Another gem from dogfish head. Malty roasted goodness with an infusion of the wood. Very very impressed.

Tasted on tap at DFH Brewings & Eats with ML. Pours dark brown/black with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malts, dark chocolate, expresso, vanilla, and cherry. Flavour is burnt sugar, chocolate, coffee, molasses, vanilla, and candied fruit. Full body, nice carbonation. What a statement for a Brown!

On tap at dogfish head very smooth good tasting brown. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very dark beer with a light head and a flavor that has a slight coffee taste overall not bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

chocolate, coffee, with a heavy malt presence. Full body, thick creamy texture, flat carbonation, long finish. Sweet flavor, pretty alcoholic for my taste, and you can taste the woody smoky notes. This beer is definitely a sipper. I realized when I poured my glass that it was going to be a rush of flavors.

On tap at whole foods. Strong alcohol aroma. Complex flavor - roasted malts, raisin, chocolate. It does leave a sour taste on my tongue maybe from the wood. I actually had a decent size head and some lacing. Definitely a great beer but the sour after taste bothers me.

Beautiful deep mocha-brown beer with a thin foamy head that forms after the glass has been filled. Rich nose of cocoa, vinegar, mild coffee, and vanilla. The initial flavor fills the mouth with profound roasted grain mixed with astringent alcohol. This then subsides into more subtle flavors of molasses, dried fruit, vanilla, and a bit of smoke. Creamy, somewhat viscous mouth feel with medium carbonation, this is definitely a beer to savor, but one is enough per session for me.
Very sweet beer. Piles of plum and apricot upfront. Black pour from bottle. Massive alcohol aroma. Fruits figs earthy. A lot going on

12oz poured into a DFH signature glass. I think they might have invented a Brown Stout by the way it looks in the glass. Dark brown with a small brown head that goes away quickly. Aroma is that of what a brown stout might smell like and I like it. I think I have to let this warm up a bit so please wait for more...Ok Im back thanks for waiting. Ive never ate any dried fruit and I havent ever had a beer that tasted like a raison so with that said here we go. Oh, and Ive never tasted wood (keep your mind out of the gutter please) so I dont know what wood taste like either. The flavor does have a hint of fruit, dry, wet light dark, I do not know. There seems to be a smokiness and almost a coffee feeling to the flavor. Heavy after taste which is ok. Kind of creamy and thick in the mouth. Are they sure this isnt a stout??? You can tell there is a high alcohol% but it isnt over bearing at all. I wonder if Ill be able to drink all 4 bottles tonight, Ill try.                    4hrs later-This is defiantly an ale once it warms up you can tell. This is a really good ale and Im glad its year around. Just got the last bottle out of the 4pk and I think Im walking crooked, a
And yes, at times I tasted wood (grow up people). +1 for taste and overall

Pour from bottle is dark brown with a paper thin tan head. 
Aroma - vanilla, caramel, sweet cherries, strawberries, cranberry and nuttiness. Also faint hint of booze. 
Taste - maraschino cherries, bubblegum, sour fruits, bitter roasted malt, booze, and citrus hops. 
Palate - chewy, syrupy mouthfeel with a heavy body. Long, sweet, fruity bitter aftertaste. 

This is one of the most interesting beers Ive had in a while. Complex aroma and flavor with a bittersweet bite. Definitely the best brown ale Ive ever had by far.

Bought a 12 oz bottle. Poured it into a chalice, which resulted in a more or less flat, 1\4" limited head. The head had a reddish brown color that had the appearance of a good espressos crema. This beer exudes sweet, fruity, vanilla notes with a fairly pronounced alcohol aroma. The pronounced alcohol smell is mirrored as strongly in the taste. The 12% ABV is very apparent, but well mingled and balanced within the sweet vanilla / caramel and the roasted grain flavors. This is a very good beer that is rich, worthy and practically boasting.

Served: 12 oz bottle
Look: pours a deep black. A dark brown head evaporates to brown spider webs. That hangs around the rim.
Smell: coffee, with a bitter hops smell
Taste: first sip has a smokey bacon flavor. Definite taste of alcohol from the start (even when chilled). When chilled slight hint of chocolate, coffee, and cherries. 
Feel: strong amount of carbonation. Smooth flavor profile for the high amount of alcohol. 
Overall:
First Drank: home Decatur March 2014

Very dark brown/black, persistent tan head. Very earthy, bready, nutty aroma with shades of dark fruit. Flavor is also very bready (dark bread), brown malt, nutty notes, a little cocoa and a hint of cola, the wood character is unusual with an earthy, oily character and a little tannic dryness. Very interesting big chewy brown ale, well made. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

There is an aroma of wood, roasted aromas, and alcohol. It is black with almost no light getting through and a deep brown head with clinging to the side. Roasted flavors dominate the taste with a pleasant wooden bite on the palate. It definitely is warming on the way down. The alcohol is strong, but not unpleasant.

Pours an opaque ruby brown with a decent sized mocha head that leaves some spotty lace. Nose involves brown sugar, minty hops, some clean chocolate, some roasted malt, sandalwood, chimney smoke, some subtle underlying cherries. Fairly sweet, quite bitter, big flavor. Big bodied, oily, viscous, fair action, drying wood action and warm finish. Really digging this, lots of cool stuff going on, very well balanced with all the elements competing for attention.

On tap it is a very dark brown not quite black with a small medium brown head. Taste is smoky coffee with hints of fruit, alcohol is not notably present. Full creamy smooth mouthfeel is very nice. Not what youd normally expect in an ale it is more akin to a stout and is surely to be sipped and enjoyed.

Boozy, salty, ocean-like nose. Super dark like a stout...but it isnt. Caramel foam. Peppery hops, bright middle. Funk in the finish. This is good, but I really dont know what to compare it to. Almost like CBCs Blunderbuss at some points, but totally not at other points.
(bottle) clear very dark brown colour with a small brown head; aroma of wood, brown sugar, flowers; rich intense balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish; somewhat thick palate

Incredible look and feel to this beer. Dark and beautiful. Dark fruit on the nose with some smoke/wood. Taste was a little sweet with some fruit to it. Complicated beer. Great find

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours dark brown with a fat 'no foamy mocha head. Visually carbonated throughout and this one speaks to you. Nice natural lacing as the head slowly bubbles down. Aroma is smoky wood, caramel and vanilla. Taste is surprising. Roasted caramel and cocoa malts, vanilla and smoked wood, cherries and wine. Strong alcohol undertone out the back. Somewhat cloying on the palate. Aftertaste is earthy malts, charred wood and booze. More Belgian than brown ale. A very nice, well-crafted beer but a few points off for over the top booze (something no longer noticed after half a brew).

Poured from 12 fl oz bottle. Very dark brown with tan head. Aroma of smoke and chocolate with some mild coffee. Flavour of sweet smoke and light chocolate. Medium alcohol and wood on the finish. Full body. Great balance.

Deep black-brown pour with orange-tan head. Nose of brown sugar, light roast malt, and wood. Flavor is very wood-forward with moderately astringent tanins, light smoke, olive, roast malt, and faint brown sugar. Lingering tanins and booze. Very porter-like. The wood is a bit heavy-handed at times (as is the alcohol), but overall a nice sipper with some unique qualities.
Very interesting and complex flavor. The finish is very clean for an imperial. Very dark color and good aroma.

A dark brown with a beige head. Aroma contains some smokey notes with chocolate and coffee notes. A bit of nutmeg also. The flavor is sweet and rich with caramel, nutmeg, and chocolate. A burnt wood thing going on. Overall excellent beer.
Truly incredible stuff. Super easy to drink for a 12% beer thats this complex. The barrel flavor is very unique and contributes some great sweet, earthy notes.

Palo Santo = Holy Tree; DFH brew = HOLY WOW! BIG beer, lots of flavor packed in this one. Chocolate dark color, wood/malt/alcohol in the odor and palate. At 12%, it is very drinkable though a sipping beer - might be great with a med/mild cigar!

Pours dark brown with a tan head into a snifter. Smells of roasty malts and faint wood. Great aroma. Sweet malts fade into a woody flavor with a bit of alcohol heat. Nice. Silky on the palate.

Really good beer. Love the wood character. I would be interested in how this one ages.
my new favorite beer! the smell and the taste is just outstanding,there is so much wonderful flavor to this that i think its better than Bourbon County Stout

12 oz. bottle. Pours a black color with a brief tan head that disappears. Aroma is of smokiness, malt & some spiciness. Id say this is full-bodied. Taste is mostly a roasted malt flavor with some wood. Finish is slightly bitter and dry. Alcohol is cleverly hidden in this one.
Good malty, caramelly taste. There is also a fair amount of alcohol taste, although not as much as I expected for it being 12%.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2014 Pours a cola color with a nice khaki cap. Aroma is roasted malts, molasses, an earthy burnt scent, sweet spices, and booze. Flavor is dark roasted malt, dark fruit, holiday spices, chocolate, and slight booze. Medium body. Great complexity. Really good.

Pours dark like a stout with a thin tan head. Big malt flavor and sweet too. The wood from Paraguay gives this malty ale a very wonderfully unique flavor profile. A great beer. I'm yet to be disappointed by Dogfish Head. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: this beer is very dark, opaque until you hold it up to the light and then you see some brown on the edges, this beer seems very thick, has a large tan head

Aroma: alcohol, coffee, vanilla, sweet molasses, syrup, 

Taste: alcohol, vanilla, coffee, some bitterness on the finish, 

Palate: average carbonation, lots of alcohol, leaves a minimal aftertaste, heavy mouthfeel
Overall: this beer drinks like a stout or even a barley wine, definitely not a session beer, very strong alcohol

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: opaque black, light brown head, very nice Head, looked thick when pouring 
Aroma: coffee, vanilla, caramel, sweet 
Taste: potent, strong liquor taste, bitter coffee
Palette: bitter at the end, thick body 
Overall: this beer comes in with a pow! I find it hard to drink because of its intense flavor 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
6 oz draft sampler pours deep brown with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malts, fruit and wood. Taste is roasted malts, chocolate and a woody finish.

Pours dark black with a mocha head. Aromas of oak, fig, and chocolate. Lots of smoke and coffee to the taste with a slight hint of cherry. Its rather boozy which is a bit jarring upfront but the earthiness on the aftertaste mellows it out a bit. I would have preferred a bit of hop bitterness to mask the alcohol.
On tap in Gaithersburg. looks like a stout with modest head but great lacing. Very big with wine and port notes. It finishes with hops and is quite good.

12 oz bottle for 4 bucks. Pours like a stout; very dark with a brown head. Aroma is huge with dark fruit, chocolate, roasted malts, and oak. Flavor is quite robust as well. Mimics the aroma but with vanilla and hoppy bitterness at the end. Body is average, slightly slick mouthfeel. Overall this is a very good beer, similar to an Imperial Stout. Slightly thinner than I like, but still pretty good.

Vintage:2013
Appearance: Black; Minimal head; Zero Lace 
Smell: Black Cherry cough syrup; Dark Chocolate; Vanilla; Coffee
Taste: Blac Cherry; vanilla; Roasty malts; big alch
Mouth-feel: Lightish body; oily; 
Overall: Unique, complex, really good.

Absolutely vile. It was like drinking wood veneer. How can anyone taste the hops through the boozy ABV is beyond me. This is a beer that the ETOH really comes through. 

Bleh!

Malty brown woody nice beer. I'm more of an ipa fan but this was a good beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appears and tastes like a big stout. Absolutely delicious. Full bodied with a roasty finish. The aroma is sweet and woody. Becoming one of my favorites.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle picked up from Sugaya, 12%. Served in a snifter, this is a big american brown ale aged in a specially made tank made of palo santo wood from paraguay. It pours a thick viscous dark black with a slight tan almost brown head that doesnt linger. Really interesting aroma, similar to sandalwood. Im getting a soft woody nose, with oak, bacon, a touch of milk chocolate. Im not a huge fan of barrel aged beers so Im really digging the subtle aroma. Medium-full smooth body with lots of warmth spreading down my throat. The taste is similarly unique: nutty, umami, milk chocolate, woody, vanilla, light smoke with bacon notes popping up from time to time. The finish is great, a kind of earthy wood note that reminds me of smelling pipe tabacco or cigars... tabacco leaf... would love to smell the actual palo santo wood, this beer rocks.
Cola coloured pour with no head. Dried fruit aroma, a bit of caramel. Taste is plum jam, roast, burnt toffee, a little bitter on the finish.
I love this beer great flavor and so smooth for being 12%, definitely taste the complexity of the wood notes, one of my all time favs

Aroma - of roast, spices, a little alcohol, and some chocolate
Appearance - black body with a small off-white head, that turns into a small halo
Taste - was complex for sure - rich roast, dark malts, burnt sugar, some caramel, alcohol as well
Feel - very rich and the finish is long.

c/o Doug M. Beer#1 of the Craft Beer Social Club Chap #1 (LOuverture Sociale de la Bière)

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 This memorable brown ale brewed is apparently brewed in GINORMOUS wooden vessels that come from the rare Palo Santo tree wood. Dark and viscous like a stout, but candied cherries and vanilla permeate from this brown.
Bottle. Pour is deep brown. Burnt sugar, wood, and dark fruit aroma. Taste is sweet.

Draft at Winberries.
